exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 2 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
P: (nat * list (mm_instr (pos n)))%type
se: (nat * Vector.t nat n)%type
Q: nat * Vector.t nat n -> Prop
HQ0: Q se
HQ1: forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : Vector.t nat n) (j : nat) (w : Vector.t nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) ->> se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v)
s: (nat * Vector.t nat n)%type

Goal:
P // s ->> se -> Q s

Premises:
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
Inductive mm_instr (X : Set) : Set := mm_inc : X -> mm_instr X | mm_dec : X -> nat -> mm_instr X Arguments mm_instr _%type_scope Arguments mm_inc [X]%type_scope Arguments mm_dec [X]%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
nil : list ?A where ?A : [n : nat P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n)) se : nat * vec nat n Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop HQ0 : Q se HQ1 : forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) ->> se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v) s : nat * vec nat n |- Type]
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t ->
Notation pos := Fin.t

code_end : code ?X -> nat where ?X : [n : nat P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n)) se : nat * vec nat n Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop HQ0 : Q se HQ1 : forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) -> > se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v) s : nat * vec nat n |- Type]
code_start : code ?X -> nat where ?X : [n : nat P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n)) se : nat * vec nat n Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop HQ0 : Q se HQ1 : forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) -> > se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v) s : nat * vec nat n |- Type]
in_code : nat -> code ?X -> Prop where ?X : [n : nat P : nat * list (mm_instr (pos n)) se : nat * vec nat n Q : nat * vec nat n -> Prop HQ0 : Q se HQ1 : forall (i : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)) (v : vec nat n) (j : nat) (w : vec nat n), (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ // (i, v) -1> (j, w) -> P // (j, w) -> > se -> Q (j, w) -> Q (i, v) s : nat * vec nat n |- Type]

```coq
intros Hs.
destruct s as (i, v).
destruct Hs as [Hs1 | Hs2].
- inversion Hs1.
- apply HQ1 with (i := i) (ρ := mm_inc (pos n)) (v := v) (j := j) (w := w); auto.
Qed.

original: intros Hs. destruct s as (i, v). destruct Hs as [Hs1 | Hs2]. - inversion Hs1. - apply HQ1 with (i := i) (ρ := mm_inc (pos n)) (v := v) (j := j) (w := w); auto.
